alert.note: Alert for Dutchess (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 07 at 9:20PM EST until March 07 at 11:00PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM EST FOR LITCHFIELD...SOUTHEASTERN BERKSHIRE AND SOUTHERN DUTCHESS COUNTIES... At 920 PM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Otis to near Sheffield to near Lake Carmel, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Sandisfield and Middlefield around 925 PM EST. Otis around 930 PM EST. New Milford and Tolland around 935 PM EST. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Cornwall, West Torrington, South Canaan, Haight Vineyard, Baker Corner, Beekman, Hoxie Corner, Wrightville, Salisbury and South Amenia. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
